headline: Citi Jumps Applied Materials (AMAT) Target Ahead of Earnings
summary: Applied Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMAT) is included among the 15 Best Wide Moat Dividend Stocks to Invest in. On February 4, Citi analyst Atif Malik raised his price target on Applied Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMAT) to $400 from $250 and reiterated a Buy rating ahead of the company’s January-quarter earnings report scheduled for February 12. Citi is […]

headline: Evercore Stock Rises as Q4 Earnings Beat, Revenue Reaches Record Level
summary: EVR stock gains 5.2% after Q4 earnings beat estimates and adjusted revenue hit a record, fueled by strength in investment banking and investment management.

raw.headline: Evercore Stock Rises as Q4 Earnings Beat, Revenue Reaches Record Level

headline: Citigroup Announces Full Redemption of Series X Preferred Stock
summary: NEW YORK, February 05, 2026--Citigroup Inc. is redeeming, in whole, all $2.3 billion aggregate liquidation preference of Series X Depositary Shares representing interests in its 3.875% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Stock, Series X (the "Preferred Stock").

raw.headline: Citigroup Announces Full Redemption of Series X Preferred Stock
raw.summary: NEW YORK, February 05, 2026--Citigroup Inc. is redeeming, in whole, all $2.3 billion aggregate liquidation preference of Series X Depositary Shares representing interests in its 3.875% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Stock, Series X (the "Preferred Stock").

headline: 7 Bank Stocks With Solid—and Growing—Dividends
summary: “One of the things that we like about them is that they’re more resilient, and we haven’t seen excessive credit erosion,” says Matt Quinlan, a manager of the $4.7 billion  fund, citing the overall quality of loan portfolios for these banks.  Betsy Graseck, global head of banks and diversified financial research at  Morgan Stanley  points out that the large-cap U.S. banks have plenty of excess capital.  This allows them to buy back a lot of stock, often more than they allocate for dividends.

This allows them to buy back a lot of stock, often more than they allocate for dividends.

headline: Why The Narrative Around Popular (BPOP) Is Shifting After Fresh Analyst Targets And Fair Value Reset
summary: The latest update to Popular’s story centers on a higher fair value estimate, which has moved from US$145.70 to US$155.50 per share as analysts refresh their models and factor in recent Street research on mid cap banks. With several firms revisiting price targets across the group and framing 2026 as a potential catch up year for mid cap names, the new target range reflects a mix of cautious optimism and recognition that some expectations may already be priced in. Stay tuned to see how you can...
